Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Equivocation \E*quiv`o*ca"tion\, n. The use of expressions susceptible of a double signification, with a purpose to mislead. [1913 Webster]
There being no room for equivocations, there is no need of distinctions. --Locke.
Syn: Prevarication; ambiguity; shuffling; evasion; guibbling. See {Equivocal}, a., and {Prevaricate}, v. i. [1913 Webster]

equivocation n 1: a statement that is not literally false but that cleverly avoids an unpleasant truth [syn: {evasion}] 2: intentionally vague or ambiguous [syn: {prevarication}, {evasiveness}] 3: falsification by means of vague or ambiguous language [syn: {tergiversation}]
